fields.title: Privacy Policy
fields.content:
Privacy Policy

Last Updated: July 13, 2025

1. Information We Collect

We collect information you provide directly to us when you:

  • Submit an endorsement for a policy campaign
  • Contact us through our website
  • Subscribe to our communications

Personal Information

When you submit an endorsement, we collect:

  • Name and organization affiliation
  • Email address and contact information
  • Geographic location (state, county)
  • Role or title within your organization
  • Stakeholder type (farmer, business, nonprofit, etc.)
  • Optional statements supporting the campaign

Technical Information

We automatically collect certain information when you visit our website:

  • IP address and browser information
  • Pages visited and time spent on our site
  • Referring website and search terms used
  • Device and operating system information

2. How We Use Your Information

We use the information we collect to:

  • Process and display your endorsements (if you choose public display)
  • Send you updates about campaign progress and outcomes
  • Analyze stakeholder engagement and campaign effectiveness
  • Comply with legal requirements and respond to official requests
  • Improve our website and services

3. Information Sharing

We may share your information in the following circumstances:

Public Endorsements

If you choose to make your endorsement public, the following information will be displayed on our website:

  • Your name and organization
  • Your role or title
  • Your geographic location (state/county)
  • Your endorsement statement (if provided)

Campaign Advocacy

We may share aggregated endorsement data with:

  • Legislators and policymakers to demonstrate support
  • Coalition partners and advocacy organizations
  • Media outlets covering the campaign
  • Academic researchers studying policy engagement

Legal Requirements

We may disclose your information if required by law, court order, or government request.

4. Data Security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information:

  • Encrypted data transmission and storage
  • Access controls and authentication requirements
  • Regular security assessments and updates
  • Employee training on data protection

5. Data Retention

We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to:

  • Fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy
  • Comply with legal obligations and record-keeping requirements
  • Support ongoing campaign advocacy efforts

You may request deletion of your personal information by contacting us, though we may retain certain information as required by law.

6. Your Rights

Depending on your location, you may have the following rights:

  • Access to your personal information we hold
  • Correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
  • Deletion of your personal information
  • Objection to processing for specific purposes
  • Data portability (receiving your data in a portable format)

To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information below.

7. Third-Party Services

Our website may contain links to third-party websites or services. This privacy policy does not apply to those external sites. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third-party services you visit.

8. Geographic Data

We use your location information to:

  • Identify your legislative districts for targeted advocacy
  • Analyze regional support patterns
  • Customize campaign messaging for your area

Location data is never used for commercial purposes or shared with third parties for marketing.

9. Email Communications

When you submit an endorsement, you may receive:

  • Confirmation of your endorsement submission
  • Updates on campaign progress and milestones
  • Notifications about related policy initiatives
  • Invitations to participate in advocacy activities

You can opt out of email communications at any time by clicking the unsubscribe link in our emails or contacting us directly.

10. Children's Privacy

Our services are not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If we learn that we have collected such information, we will delete it promptly.

11. International Users

If you are located outside the United States, please note that we transfer, store, and process your information in the United States. By using our services, you consent to this transfer and processing.

12. Changes to This Policy

We may update this privacy policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of significant changes by:

  • Posting the updated policy on our website
  • Sending email notifications to registered users
  • Updating the \"Last Updated\" date at the top of this policy

13. Contact Information

If you have questions about this privacy policy or our data practices, please contact us:

  • Email: [Your organization's privacy contact email]
  • Address: [Your organization's mailing address]
  • Phone: [Your organization's contact phone number]

14. State-Specific Rights

California Residents

Under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), California residents have additional rights including:

  • Right to know what personal information is collected and how it's used
  • Right to delete personal information
  • Right to opt-out of the sale of personal information (we do not sell personal information)
  • Right to non-discrimination for exercising privacy rights

European Union Residents

Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), EU residents have rights including:

  • Lawful basis for processing (legitimate interest in policy advocacy)
  • Right to access, rectify, erase, or restrict processing
  • Right to data portability and to object to processing
  • Right to lodge a complaint with supervisory authorities
